text.__SUMMARY__: Gymnopilus bellulus is a species of mushroom in the Cortinariaceae family.  It was given its current name by American mycologist Murrill in 1917.
text.Description: The cap is 1 to 2.5 centimetres (0.4 to 1.0 in) in diameter.
text.Habitat and distribution: Gymnopilus bellulus has been found on conifer stumps and logs in the Northern United States, Tennessee, and Canada from June to January.
